title: I want to start reading comic books (DC comics, in particular). What's a good place to start? - Quora

response.answer_text: Batman: Hush  Honestly there are many great starting places but if you’ve never read a comic or a dc comic, just start here. It’s a beautiful book. Jim Lee’s Art almost defines DC. It’s a great story and Batman will always be the number one DC Character and Family. I’d give this to literally anyone as first read. And then I would use what they liked / disliked as a guide to what to give them more of.

You should start from Rebirth to ease your way into DC, pick a character yo are interested in and research their first Rebirth issue. After you have some knowledge over different characters you can hit up Comic Book Herald and look up Reading Orders for characters you liked to immerse yourself more into their and DC’s lore. Some of my personal favorites: SandmanLuciferHellblazerSuperman: Earth OneBatman: Earth OneFlash: BlitzFlash: Rogue’s RevengeFlash: Fastest Man Alive
